019package org.tquadrat.foundation.util.internal;
020
021import static java.lang.Integer.signum;
022import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.INTERNAL;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.NOT_FOUND;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.isNull;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
027
028import java.util.Comparator;
029import java.util.List;
030
031import org.apiguardian.api.API;
032import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
033import org.tquadrat.foundation.util.Comparators.KeyProvider;
034
035/**
036 *  Sometimes a special sort order is required that cannot defined as a rule.
037 *  Instead a list defines the sequence.
038 *
039 *  @param  <T> The type to order.
040 *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may be
041 *      the same as the type itself.
042 *
043 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
044 *  @version $Id: ListBasedComparator.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $
045 *  @since 0.0.5
046 *
047 *  @UMLGraph.link
048 */
049@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: ListBasedComparator.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $" )
050@API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
051public class ListBasedComparator<T,K> implements Comparator<T>
052{
053        /*---------------*\
054    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
055        \*---------------*/
056    /**
057     *  A simple implementation of
058     *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.util.Comparators.KeyProvider}
059     *  that returns the instance itself as the sort order key.
060     *
061     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
062     *  @version $Id: ListBasedComparator.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $
063     *
064     *  @param  <T> The type to order.
065     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
066     *      be the same as the type itself. At least, an instance of type
067     *      {@code T} must be assignable to {@code K}.
068     *
069     *  @UMLGraph.link
070     */
071    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: ListBasedComparator.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $" )
072    private static class SimpleKeyProvider<T,K> implements KeyProvider<T,K>
073    {
074            /*--------------*\
075        ====** Constructors **=================================================
076            \*--------------*/
077        /**
078         *  Creates a new {@code SimpleKeyProvider} instance.
079         */
080        public SimpleKeyProvider() { /* Just exists */ }
081
082            /*---------*\
083        ====** Methods **======================================================
084            \*---------*/
085        /**
086         *  {@inheritDoc}
087         *
088         *  @return The instance itself as the sort order key; {@code null} if
089         *      the instance is {@code null} itself.
090         */
091        @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
092        @Override
093        public final K getKey( final T instance ) { return (K) instance; }
094    }
095    //  class SimpleKeyProvider
096
097        /*-----------*\
098    ====** Constants **========================================================
099        \*-----------*/
100    /**
101     *  An empty array of {@code ListBasedComparator<T>} objects.
102     */
103    @SuppressWarnings( "rawtypes" )
104    public static final ListBasedComparator [] EMPTY_ListBasedComparator_ARRAY = new ListBasedComparator [0];
105
106        /*------------*\
107    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
108        \*------------*/
109    /**
110     *  The comparator that is used to determine the sort order for instances
111     *  that do not have their keys in the list; may be {@code null}.
112     */
113    private final Comparator<? super T> m_Comparator;
114
115    /**
116     *  The key provider.
117     */
118    private final KeyProvider<T,K> m_KeyProvider;
119
120    /**
121     *  The list with the sort order keys.
122     */
123    private final K [] m_Keys;
124
125        /*--------------*\
126    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
127        \*--------------*/
128    /**
129     *  Creates a new {@code ListBasedComparator} instance.
130     *
131     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
132     */
133    @SuppressWarnings( "MethodCanBeVariableArityMethod" )
134    public ListBasedComparator( final K [] keys )
135    {
136        this( new SimpleKeyProvider<>(), null, null, requireNonNullArgument( keys, "keys" ) );
137    }   //  ListBasedComparator()
138
139    /**
140     *  Creates a new {@code ListBasedComparator} instance.
141     *
142     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
143     */
144    public ListBasedComparator( final List<K> keys )
145    {
146        this( new SimpleKeyProvider<>(), null, requireNonNullArgument( keys, "keys" ), null );
147    }   //  ListBasedComparator()
148
149    /**
150     *  Creates a new {@code ListBasedComparator} instance.
151     *
152     *  @param  keyProvider The implementation of
153     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.util.Comparators.KeyProvider}
154     *      that returns the sort keys for the instances to compare.
155     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used to order the instances
156     *      that are not listed; if {@code null}, those are ordered randomly in
157     *      a non-consistent way if they or their keys do not implement the
158     *      {@link Comparable}
159     *      interface.
160     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
161     */
162    public ListBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<T,K> keyProvider, final Comparator<? super T> comparator, final List<K> keys )
163    {
164        this( keyProvider, comparator, requireNonNullArgument( keys, "keys" ), null );
165    }   //  ListBasedComparator()
166
167    /**
168     *  Creates a new {@code ListBasedComparator} instance.
169     *
170     *  @param  keyProvider The implementation of
171     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.util.Comparators.KeyProvider}
172     *      that returns the sort keys for the instances to compare.
173     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used to order the instances
174     *      that are not listed; if {@code null}, those are ordered randomly in
175     *      a non-consistent way if they or their keys do not implement the
176     *      {@link Comparable}
177     *      interface.
178     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
179     */
180    @SafeVarargs
181    public ListBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<T,K> keyProvider, final Comparator<? super T> comparator, final K... keys )
182    {
183        this( keyProvider, comparator, null, requireNonNullArgument( keys, "keys" ) );
184    }   //  ListBasedComparator()
185
186    /**
187     *  Creates a new {@code ListBasedComparator} instance.
188     *
189     *  @param  keyProvider The implementation of
190     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.util.Comparators.KeyProvider}
191     *      that returns the sort keys for the instances to compare.
192     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used to order the instances
193     *      that are not listed; if {@code null}, those are ordered randomly in
194     *      a non-consistent way if they or their keys do not implement the
195     *      {@link Comparable}
196     *      interface.
197     *  @param  keysList    The sort order keys in a list; is {@code null} when
198     *      {@code keysArray} is not {@code null}.
199     *  @param  keysArray   The sort order keys in an array; is {@code null}
200     *      when {@code keysList} is not {@code null}.
201     */
202    @SuppressWarnings( {"unchecked", "MethodCanBeVariableArityMethod"} )
203    private ListBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<T,K> keyProvider, final Comparator<? super T> comparator, final List<K> keysList, final K [] keysArray )
204    {
205        assert isNull( keysList ) ^ isNull( keysArray ) : "Both, keysList and keysArray are either null or not null";
206
207        //noinspection SuspiciousArrayCast
208        m_Keys = nonNull( keysList ) ? (K []) keysList.toArray() : keysArray.clone();
209        m_KeyProvider = requireNonNullArgument( keyProvider, "keyProvider" );
210        m_Comparator = comparator;
211    }   //  ListBasedComparator()
212
213        /*---------*\
214    ====** Methods **==========================================================
215        \*---------*/
216    /**
217     *  {@inheritDoc}
218     */
219    @SuppressWarnings( {"rawtypes", "unchecked", "preview"} )
220    @Override
221    public final int compare( final T o1, final T o2 )
222    {
223        var retValue = 0; // Assuming that the values are equal …
224        if( o1 != o2 ) // Not identical …
225        {
226            /*
227             *  Retrieve the keys and get the index for the respective key. A
228             *  value of -1 (NOT_FOUND) indicates that the key was not found in
229             *  the list of keys and that the natural order should be used for
230             *  the respective entry.
231             */
232            final var key1 = m_KeyProvider.getKey( o1 );
233            final var index1 = searchKey( key1 );
234            assert index1 == NOT_FOUND || index1 >= 0;
235            final var key2 = m_KeyProvider.getKey( o2 );
236            final var index2 = searchKey( key2 );
237            assert index2 == NOT_FOUND || index2 >= 0;
238
239            if( index1 == index2 )
240            {
241                /*
242                 *  If both index values are not -1, this means that the keys
243                 *  are equals and therefore the instances are to be treated
244                 *  as equals, too.
245                 */
246                if( index1 == NOT_FOUND )
247                {
248                    //---* Both are not in the list *--------------------------
249                    //noinspection IfStatementWithTooManyBranches
250                    if( nonNull( m_Comparator ) )
251                    {
252                        //---* Use the comparator if we have one *-------------
253                        retValue = signum( m_Comparator.compare( o1, o2 ) );
254                    }
255                    else if( key1 instanceof Comparable comparable )
256                    {
257                        //---* Use the implicit natural order *----------------
258                        retValue = signum( comparable.compareTo( key2 ) );
259                    }
260                    else if( (o1 != key1) || (o2 != key2) )
261                    /*
262                     * Yes, we know that we do check for *identity* here! If
263                     * no explicit KeyProvider was given, the SimpleKeyProvider
264                     * is used, and that will return o# as Key#. This would
265                     * mean that we have performed the action below already
266                     * above …
267                     */
268                    {
269                        if( o1 instanceof Comparable comparable )
270                        {
271                            retValue = signum( comparable.compareTo( o2 ) );
272                        }
273                    }
274                    else
275                    {
276                        /*
277                         * We have no idea how to order, so we just compare the
278                         * hashcodes of the keys.
279                         */
280                        retValue = Long.signum( (long) key1.hashCode() - (long) key2.hashCode() );
281                    }
282                }
283            }
284            else
285            {
286                /*
287                 * That one that is in the list is less than the other one.
288                 */
289                if( index1 == NOT_FOUND )
290                {
291                    retValue = 1;
292                }
293                else if( index2 == NOT_FOUND )
294                {
295                    retValue = -1;
296                }
297                else
298                {
299                    /*
300                     * That one that is closer to the begin of the list is less
301                     * than the other one.
302                     */
303                    retValue = signum( index1 - index2 );
304                }
305            }
306        }
307
308        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
309        return retValue;
310    }   //  compare()
311
312    /**
313     *  Searches the given key in the list.
314     *
315     *  @param  key The key.
316     *  @return The index in the list or
317     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NOT_FOUND}
318     *      ({@value org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NOT_FOUND})
319     *      if the key is not in the list.
320     */
321    private int searchKey( final K key )
322    {
323        /*
324         * Although using Arrays.binarySearch() looked a good idea at first
325         * place, it does not work as we are not allowed to sort the key's
326         * array, for obvious reasons.
327         */
328        var found = false;
329        var retValue = m_Keys.length;
330        while( !found && (--retValue >= 0) )
331        {
332            found = (key == m_Keys [retValue]) || (nonNull( key ) && key.equals( m_Keys [retValue] ));
333        }
334
335        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
336        return retValue;
337    }   //  searchKey()
338}
339//  class ListBasedComparator
340

342 *  End of File
